Nerangs.ab: āat̰ dīš āuuaēδaiiamahi pad ēn gyāg taštag kē-š hōm ud urwarām andar pad datuš abāz nihišn ud pad urwēs bē nihišn hāwan az kustag ī hōy ō kustag ī dašn āwarišn pad rōy nigūn kunišn bōy ō ī ātaxš dahišn asńiiaēibiiō aṣ̌ahe ratubiiō. ...

"āat̰ dīš āuuaēδaiiamahi At this passage, he has to put again in contact with the datuš the saucer that contains the hōm and urwarām and (then) to put it on the urwēs; he has to bring the hāwan from the left side to the right side and put it upside-down; he has to give bōy to the fire (and continue with) asńiiaēibiiō aṣ̌ahe ratubiiō. ..."
